input_text:
Job Title: Main Assembly Lead Operator, 2nd Shift

Location: Irving, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description:

Mentor Texas LP is recruiting for a(n) Main Assembly Lead Operator, 2nd Shift, located in Irving, TX.

Are you interested in making a difference in a growing company thriving on a diverse culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, and committed to inclusion? Apply today for this phenomenal opportunity!

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Key Responsibilities:

Executes and monitors manufacturing processes according to operational procedures. Prioritizes based on production schedule.Coordinates and leads day-to-day activities in the production manufacturing area as vital, in alignment with immediate or direct supervision.Monitors assigned areas and reallocates resources as necessary to meet schedule requirements within the department.Demonstrates leadership skills to build a team-based, non-threatening environment that promotes teamwork and open exchanges of ideas.Become skilled in using and inspiring others on factory information systems.Ensures compliance with all Federal, State, local, and Company regulations, policies, and procedures.

Qualifications:

Education:

High School Diploma or GED required. An Associates Degree is helpful.

Experience and Skills:

Required: 

A minimum of 2 years of manufacturing experience directly required.Basic Computer and database leadership skills.Must have mechanical skills and provide documentation of these skills and experience, upon request.Solid understanding of basic hand tools (i.e. screwdrivers, wrenches, snips, cutters) and inspection equipment (i.e. optical comparators, micrometers, microscopes, plug gauges).Working knowledge of shop math such as decimals, fractions, and tolerances.

Other:

Requires ability and flexibility to work operational hours of 01:30 PM to 10:00 PM Monday-Friday, plus time for communication and overtime as appropriate.Able to read, understand, explain, and measure performance concerning process and quality documents.Work in a team environment behaving in a CREDO-based supportive manner.Align with all federally supervised programs.Adhere to J&J environmental and safety policies and guidelines.Follow all job-specific safety procedures and apply PPE when vital.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career, and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.]

Experience Level (if available): None

Coordinates and leads day-to-day activities in the production manufacturing area.
Monitors assigned areas and reallocates resources as necessary to meet schedule requirements within the department.
Demonstrates leadership skills to build a team-based, non-threatening environment.
Becomes skilled in using and inspiring others on factory information systems.
Ensures compliance with all Federal, State, local, and Company regulations, policies, and procedures.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
